@graph.caption: two loaves of amish white bread on cooling rack

@graph.name: Homemade Amish White Bread Yields 2 Delicious Loaves
@graph.description: This recipe for homemade Amish white bread yields 2 loaves of perfectly soft white bread. Perfect for sandwiches, toast, or eating fresh from the oven with butter. It has been a family favorite for years!

@graph.name: Brandy
@graph.description: Welcome! I'm Brandy, mother to 5 darling kiddos and a cute black lab named Toby. My husband is in the Coast Guard so we've lived all over the place, turning each house into a home. I love baking, sewing, making cute things with my kids, and sharing what I've learned with all of you!

@graph.name: Homemade Amish White Bread
@graph.description: This recipe for homemade Amish white bread yields 2 loaves of perfectly soft white bread. Perfect for sandwiches, toast, or eating fresh from the oven with butter. It has been a family favorite for years!

video.name: Amish White Bread
video.description: This recipe for homemade Amish white bread yields 2 loaves of perfectly soft white bread. Perfect for sandwiches, toast, or eating fresh from the oven with butter. It has been a family favorite for years!

recipeIngredient: butter for brushing on finished loaves

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, dissolve the sugar in warm water, and then stir in yeast. Allow to proof until foamy (about 5 minutes).
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, dissolve the sugar in warm water, and then stir in yeast. Allow to proof until foamy (about 5 minutes).

recipeInstructions.text: Mix oil into the yeast mixture. Mix salt and flour (1 cup at a time) in with the wet ingredients. Stir until a soft dough forms.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix oil into the yeast mixture. Mix salt and flour (1 cup at a time) in with the wet ingredients. Stir until a soft dough forms.

recipeInstructions.text: Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth (3-5 minutes)
recipeInstructions.name: Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth (3-5 minutes)

recipeInstructions.text: Place in a  oiled bowl, and turn dough to coat. Cover with a damp cloth.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in a  oiled bowl, and turn dough to coat. Cover with a damp cloth.

recipeInstructions.text: Punch dough down. Divide dough in half.
recipeInstructions.name: Punch dough down. Divide dough in half.

recipeInstructions.text: Shape into loaves, and place into two greased bread pans. You can either pat dough into a loaf shape or roll the dough into a loaf shape (like you would if making cinnamon rolls).
recipeInstructions.name: Shape into loaves, and place into two greased bread pans. You can either pat dough into a loaf shape or roll the dough into a loaf shape (like you would if making cinnamon rolls).

recipeInstructions.text: Brush with butter while in pans. Cool 5 minutes and then remove bread from pans and cool on a rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush with butter while in pans. Cool 5 minutes and then remove bread from pans and cool on a rack.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap in plastic wrap while still slightly warm to make a nice soft crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap in plastic wrap while still slightly warm to make a nice soft crust.
